body:
I don't know of any such variable, so I know that I didn't set it.  Is it possible it is a default value?
Looking through my environment variables, I see no variable with any CUDA settings (other than CUDA_HOME)
Regardless, can I just force this environment variable to, say, 10GiB (or 10000 since it's in MB). For example:
```
TF_CUDA_HOST_MEM_LIMIT_IN_MB = 10000
export TF_CUDA_HOST_MEM_LIMIT_IN_MB
```
Alternatively, can this be set from in Tensorflow or Python?
